Based on these constraints, I recommend the movie "Maleficent" (2014) starring Angelina Jolie Pitt as a vengeful fairy who discovers that the child she has cursed may be the one person who can restore peace to their troubled land. The movie's unique blend of fantasy and drama will keep you engaged and thoughtful.

Alternatively, I suggest "Blue Valentine" (2010) which follows the evolution of a contemporary married couple over a span of years through a clever cross-cutting between time periods. The talented cast, including Michelle Williams and Ryan Gosling, bring depth and emotion to their characters, making for a thought-provoking watch.

Based on the user's constraints, I would recommend "Doubt" (2008) starring Meryl Streep, Philip Seymour Hoffman, and Carrie Preston. The movie is a powerful drama that explores themes of morality, guilt, and redemption within the context of a Catholic school setting. Alternatively, "A Time to Kill" (1989) starring Kevin Smith, Patrick Stewart, and Chris Evans is also an intense and thought-provoking film that delves into issues of race, justice, and violence in the American South.
